c74object.name: fl.pad~
c74object.digest: Pads the input frame with a repeated specified value
c74object.description: Padding may be applied to either the start or the end of the frame or both. Padding amounts may be set in samples, or as a ratio of the input length. The output length is at least the size of the input.

entry.name: /start [double]
entry.description: Sets the amount of padding to apply to the start of the frame.

entry.name: /end [double]
entry.description: Sets the amount of padding to apply to the end of the frame.

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the units for padding amounts (samples or ratios [0-1]).
[0] - samples[1] - ratios

objarg.name: pad
objarg.description:
This argument sets the pad parameter:
Sets the padding value.

objarg.name: start
objarg.digest: Sets the amount of padding to apply to the start of the frame
objarg.description:
This argument sets the start parameter:
Sets the amount of padding to apply to the start of the frame.

objarg.name: end
objarg.digest: Sets the amount of padding to apply to the end of the frame
objarg.description:
This argument sets the end parameter:
Sets the amount of padding to apply to the end of the frame.

objarg.name: units
objarg.digest: Sets the units for padding amounts (samples or ratios [0-1])
objarg.description:
This argument sets the units parameter:
Sets the units for padding amounts (samples or ratios [0-1]).
[0] - samples[1] - ratios

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.pad~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.pad~. When set to 0 fl.pad~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.pad~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
